docs.snippet: RYAN NELSEN, a defender for New Zealand and D.C. United, did not particularly want last weekend off. He had no choice.      Nelsen was ejected from United's match on May 17 for what Major League Soccer called ''serious foul play'' against Kansas...
docs.lead_paragraph: RYAN NELSEN, a defender for New Zealand and D.C. United, did not particularly want last weekend off. He had no choice. Nelsen was ejected from United's match on May 17 for what Major League Soccer called ''serious foul play'' against Kansas City's KERRY ZAVAGNIN. ''It was a slick field and I couldn't stop; I couldn't pull out,'' he said. ''The guy made a meal out of it. He should be on Broadway.''
docs.abstract: New Zealand defender Ryan Nelsen, who also plays for DC United, helps bring New Zealand into forefront of international soccer (M)

headline.main: New Zealand All-Whites Vs. Red, White and Blue

docs.snippet: In what was described as an important political step for European defense cooperation, the 15 governments of the European Union agreed today to send a joint peacekeeping force to Congo to help contain ethnic violence.    The 1,400-member force, which...
docs.lead_paragraph: In what was described as an important political step for European defense cooperation, the 15 governments of the European Union agreed today to send a joint peacekeeping force to Congo to help contain ethnic violence. The 1,400-member force, which was authorized by the United Nations last Friday, will mark the first time the European Union carries out a military operation without help from the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. It will also be the first European Union military operation outside of Europe.
docs.abstract: European Union governments agree to send joint peacekeeping force to Congo to help contain ethnic violence; 1,400-member force, which was authorized by United Nations, marks first time European Union will carry out military operation without help from North Atlantic Treaty Organization and first European Union military operation outside of Europe (M)

headline.main: European Peacekeepers to Go To Congo on Non-NATO Mission

docs.snippet: History at the Harbor      They're proud of their village and want to show it off. So residents of Mamaroneck have organized the Historic Harbor Street Fair, a festival of free events that will take place downtown today from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m....
docs.lead_paragraph: History at the Harbor They're proud of their village and want to show it off. So residents of Mamaroneck have organized the Historic Harbor Street Fair, a festival of free events that will take place downtown today from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Mamaroneck Avenue will become a pedestrian mall featuring Native American storytelling and dancing; children's games played with sticks, hoops, spoons and eggs and a Civil War-era brass band. There will be a tribute to Norman Rockwell, who lived in Mamaroneck, and a one-room schoolhouse, circa 1816, will provide a glimpse of past school days. Jitterbug dancing to a live swing band will take place in a 1940's canteen, while silent Buster Keaton movies accompanied by the pianist Ben Model will recall Mamaroneck's golden age of filmmaking in the 1920's. The films will be shown free at the Clearview Cinemas' Mamaroneck Playhouse Theater.
docs.abstract: Footlights column: Historic Harbor Street Fair is slated to open in Mamaroneck, NY; Nowhere to Run, documentary produced by Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition, wins Silver Award in short subject film and video documentary category at 36th annual WorldFest-Houston International Film Festival; fourth graders at King Street School in Port Chester participate in educational program at Neuberger Museum of Art under grant from New York State Council on Arts; soprano Jennifer Marshall of Larchmont wins place in inaugural class of new Renata Scotto Opera Academy at Music Conservatory of Westchester in White Plains; photo (M)

docs.snippet: NO END TO WAR  Terrorism in the 21st Century  By Walter Laqueur  288 pages. Continuum. $24.95.      The study of terrorism has long been one of the more intellectually suspect fields of academic (and quasi-academic) endeavor. When not engaging in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: NO END TO WAR Terrorism in the 21st Century By Walter Laqueur 288 pages. Continuum. $24.95. The study of terrorism has long been one of the more intellectually suspect fields of academic (and quasi-academic) endeavor. When not engaging in the endless and fruitless debate about who should be counted as a terrorist, too many of the experts preen on television while delivering unfounded speculation.
docs.abstract: Benjamin Schwarz reviews book No End to War: Terrorism in the 21st Century by Walter Laqueur; drawing (M)

headline.main: Examining Terrorism's Roots And Taking Aim at Its Myths

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: NO END TO WAR: TERRORISM IN THE 21ST CENTURY (BOOK)

docs.snippet: Defying notions about Japanese deflation, Tokyo is again the most expensive city in the world.    A 4 percent drop in the exchange value of the dollar against the Japanese yen helped keep Tokyo in first place and place Osaka third in an annual...
docs.lead_paragraph: Defying notions about Japanese deflation, Tokyo is again the most expensive city in the world. A 4 percent drop in the exchange value of the dollar against the Japanese yen helped keep Tokyo in first place and place Osaka third in an annual cost-of-living survey of 144 major world cities conducted in March by Mercer Human Resources Consulting of Geneva, a Marsh & McLennan company.
docs.abstract: Cost-of-living survey by Mercer Human Resources Consulting and Marsh & McLennan finds Tokyo is again most expensive city in world despite 1 percent annual drop in prices in yen, thanks to yen's rise in value against dollar; Osaka places third and New York 10th; table of world's most expensive cities (M)

headline.main: A Strong Yen Helps Tokyo Retain Status as Most Costly

docs.snippet: In an inaugural address notable for its promise of change, it was President Néstor Kirchner's insistence that he intended to exercise power ''without rancor but with memory'' that most struck Argentines. ''I am part of a decimated generation,'' he...
docs.lead_paragraph: In an inaugural address notable for its promise of change, it was President Néstor Kirchner's insistence that he intended to exercise power ''without rancor but with memory'' that most struck Argentines. ''I am part of a decimated generation,'' he said, referring to the victims of the 1976-83 military dictatorship here, ''and I do not believe in the axiom that when you govern you trade convictions for pragmatism.'' In less than a month in office, Mr. Kirchner has proved as good as his word, forcing the long-dormant issue of justice for the estimated 30,000 people who disappeared during that ''dirty war'' to center stage. Not only has he purged the military high command, he has also announced his willingness to allow the extradition of human rights violators wanted in other countries and made it clear that he wants the Supreme Court to declare unconstitutional a series of amnesty laws and pardons that have been in effect for more than a decade.
docs.abstract: Letter From South America reports that Pres Nestor Kirchner is carrying out inaugural pledge to seek justice for estimated 30,000 people who disappeared during 'dirty war' of military dictatorship between 1976 and 1983; photo of mass grave; Kirchner purges military command, says he will allow extradition of human rights violators wanted in other countries and makes clear he wants Supreme Court to overturn amnesty laws and pardons (M)

headline.main: Now the Dirtiest of Wars Won't Be Forgotten

docs.snippet: Olivier Baussan heard that olive trees had been planted in central Uruguay about 50 years ago by French immigrants. So, being the founder of Oliviers & Company, a chain of shops specializing in olive products, he decided to investigate. From his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Olivier Baussan heard that olive trees had been planted in central Uruguay about 50 years ago by French immigrants. So, being the founder of Oliviers & Company, a chain of shops specializing in olive products, he decided to investigate. From his visit has come a new golden oil called Los Ranchos. It has a lively, grassy, vegetal flavor that makes it excellent to drizzle on grilled fish with herbs or as a copious pour on vegetable salads. But not too copious, at $29 for 16.8 ounces. The oil is available at the Oliviers stores and soon will be at www.oliviers-co.com.
docs.abstract: Olive oil from Uruguay is available at Oliviers & Co stores; photo (S)

headline.main: Olive Oil Worth a Trip to Uruguay

docs.snippet: The Congolese government and two rebel factions agreed today to halt fighting in an eastern region and pull back from newly occupied areas, hours after a battle for a town there killed dozens of people.    The cease-fire was signed in neighboring...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Congolese government and two rebel factions agreed today to halt fighting in an eastern region and pull back from newly occupied areas, hours after a battle for a town there killed dozens of people. The cease-fire was signed in neighboring Burundi by the Congolese government, the Rwandan-backed Congolese Rally for Democracy and the government-allied Congolese Rally for Democracy-ML.
docs.abstract: Congolese government and two rebel factions sign cease-fire accord in neighboring Burundi, agreeing to halt fighting in eastern region and pull back from newly occupied areas (S)

docs.snippet: Although relatively few American producers -- none from New York -- participated in Vinexpo, perhaps the world's greatest international wine exposition, it was obvious that a Long Island delegation could have easily held its own.    Exploring the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although relatively few American producers -- none from New York -- participated in Vinexpo, perhaps the world's greatest international wine exposition, it was obvious that a Long Island delegation could have easily held its own. Exploring the aisles in a huge exposition center in Bordeaux for four days in late June, tasting and comparing countless wines, I was impressed by how well East End whites and reds would have competed against counterparts from the 2,500 exhibitors from 40 countries.
docs.abstract: Howard Goldberg column on Vinexpo in Bordeaux, France (Long Island Vines column) (M)

docs.snippet: At about 5:45 tonight, the Concorde flew directly over the All England Club, the last time it will pass over during a Wimbledon tournament. The British Airways supersonic jet will be phased out of service in October.    Ninety minutes later, another...
docs.lead_paragraph: At about 5:45 tonight, the Concorde flew directly over the All England Club, the last time it will pass over during a Wimbledon tournament. The British Airways supersonic jet will be phased out of service in October. Ninety minutes later, another sleek and glorious relic, Martina Navratilova, going on 47, collected her 20th Wimbledon championship, tying Billie Jean King for the record.
docs.abstract: Martina Navratilova and Leander Paes defeat Andy Ram and Anastassia Rodionova to win mixed doubles title at Wimbledon; Navratilova wins 20th Wimbledon championship, tying Billy Jean King's record; photo (M)

headline.main: Still Flying High, Navratilova Ties King's Record
